Package gw.api.validation

Class EntityValidationException

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Throwable
java.lang.Exception
java.lang.RuntimeException
com.guidewire.pl.web.controller.UserDisplayableException
gw.api.validation.EntityValidationException
All Implemented Interfaces:
HasErrorInfo, Serializable
public class EntityValidationException extends com.guidewire.pl.web.controller.UserDisplayableException
Thrown when an entity fails validation. Always contains at least one, and maybe many, ValidationExecutionResult objects.
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    EntityValidationException(ValidationResult vr, ValidationLevel level)
    Constructs a new EntityValidationException with a list of the ValidationExecutionResults obtained from the entity validations of the given ValidationResult.

    Constructs a new EntityValidationException with a single ValidationExecutionResult formed from the given data.
    EntityValidationException(List<? extends ValidationExecutionResult> results)
    Constructs a new EntityValidationException with a list of ValidationExecutionResults.

  • Constructor Details

    • EntityValidationException

      public EntityValidationException(Key entityKey, ValidationLevel level, IValidationResult result)
      Constructs a new EntityValidationException with a single ValidationExecutionResult formed from the given data.

    • EntityValidationException

      public EntityValidationException(List<? extends ValidationExecutionResult> results)
      Constructs a new EntityValidationException with a list of ValidationExecutionResults. The list must be non-empty.

    • EntityValidationException

      public EntityValidationException(ValidationResult vr, ValidationLevel level)
      Constructs a new EntityValidationException with a list of the ValidationExecutionResults obtained from the entity validations of the given ValidationResult.

  • Method Details

    • getAllErrorMessages

      public List<String> getAllErrorMessages()
      A list containing all the error and warning messages for this exception, as strings
      Returns:
      a non null list of strings. In normal use the list should never be empty - a validation exception is only created if validation fails for some reason

    • getBundleValidationOption

      public BundleValidationOption getBundleValidationOption()
      Returns the bundle validation option to use if the bundle is re-committed. Constructs a bundle validation option containing all the error messages associated with this exception. If the re-commit uses this option and only encounters validation warnings then it will succeed if the warning messages are a subset of the error messages already encountered (that is if they are a subset of the error messages given by this exception).

      This is used to implement the behavior that validation warnings block the first attempt at an update but not the second attempt.

      Returns:
      a bundle validation option to be used on the next commit, never null

    • getBundleValidationOption

      public BundleValidationOption getBundleValidationOption(BundleValidationOption lastValidationOption)
      Similar to getBundleValidationOption(), but returns a validation option that combines all errors in last validation option and new ones in this exception.
      Parameters:
      lastValidationOption - last validation option, if any
      Returns:
      a new validation option that combines old and new errors

    • getResults

      public List<ValidationExecutionResult> getResults()
      Guaranteed to return at least one result

    • hasErrors

      public boolean hasErrors()
      Check if any of the enclosed validation results contains an error at a significant level. For example, will return true if there is an error at a low level and the validation result was trying to achieve a high level. But will return false if the only errors are at a higher level then the level we are trying to achieve.

    • getMessage

      public String getMessage()
      Overrides:
      getMessage in class Throwable

    • combine

      public EntityValidationException combine(EntityValidationException other)
      Returns a new exception containing the ValidationExecutionResults from this exception plus the ValidationExecutionResults from 'other'.
      Parameters:
      other - the other EntityValidationException, must not be null
      Returns:
      new exception containing the combined ValidationExecutionResults
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if other is null
